In early 1998, [[Prince (musician)|Prince]] (who at the time went by [[File:Prince logo.svg|20px]], an unpronounceable symbol) released '''''Crystal Ball''''', a four-disc set containing a three CD [[compilation album]] of the same name featuring a much anticipated collection of "previously [[Bootleg recording|bootlegged]]" material, with '''''The Truth''''', a bonus disc of 12 new acoustic songs. [[Internet]] pre-orders included an [[instrumental]] album, '''''Kamasutra'''''.
+
In early 1998, [[Prince (musician)|Prince]] (who at the time went by an unpronounceable symbol) released '''''Crystal Ball''''', a four-disc set containing a three CD [[compilation album]] of the same name featuring a much anticipated collection of "previously [[Bootleg recording|bootlegged]]" material, with '''''The Truth''''', a bonus disc of 12 new acoustic songs. [[Internet]] pre-orders included an [[instrumental]] album, '''''Kamasutra'''''.
Prince once planned to release a 3-[[Gramophone record|LP]] album around 1986, also called ''[[Crystal Ball (unreleased album)|Crystal Ball]]''. That album was edited down to a 2-LP and renamed ''[[Sign o' the Times (album)|Sign o' the Times]]''. Its title track became the title track for this compilation, 10 years later.
Prince once planned to release a 3-[[Gramophone record|LP]] album around 1986, also called ''[[Crystal Ball (unreleased album)|Crystal Ball]]''. That album was edited down to a 2-LP and renamed ''[[Sign o' the Times (album)|Sign o' the Times]]''. Its title track became the title track for this compilation, 10 years later.
